name: Paragon of Pain: Bard 8/ RDD 10/ Blackguard 22
author: campgod

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
This is a raw brute with high AB, strength 40, sneak attacks, divine damage and a bludgeoning two-hander.
Attack is the best defence, but even so the AC and saves are quite all right.
He also spawns an epic pet from the abyss.

All other builds I have found with this class spread are "balanced" strength and charisma builds, so that makes this build different for better or worse.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Powerful, just powerful...

These (Bard/BG/RDD) builds are the next best thing after (FTR/ROG/CoT) and you prove it easily here Mick. Build is solid rock, nough said.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey Mick!

This is a BEAST, mate! You did really really well. The only thing I don't like about this guy is that he strengthens the Evil side. High AB, high damage, UMD, Taunt/Expertise combo, a true MONSTER!

Now seriously I do have a tweak to suggest for those who play in worlds where you can count on some items to cap charisma. I would drop Improved Critical all day long for Divine Shield. You get 10% chance of dealing double damage IF YOU AREN'T FIGHTING UNDEADS OR PMs. With Divine Shield, it gives you options to raise your AC and even tank a little, although it's not your forte.

Inversely, you could drop Divine Might if you have no way to boost CHA for Improved KD.

Overal, really good build! :D

Take it EZ!

posts.author: campgod
posts.content: I really want to try a BG build. Now with that said I was looking at this one and Valerfor's one he posted in the Yardstick: Prestige builds (fighter10/BG30) what are the main differences? Also Mick, is there a way to get Dev crit in this build? Thanks for your time.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content: Campgod, Yardstick builds are inherently weaker because they are "generic" builds made to max out one class. This one is a VERY GOOD BG build. U can't go wrong with it! And yes, you can go DevCrit. You would need to drop Divine Might for Great Cleave and two Great Strengths for Overwhelming and Devastating Critical, but it's doable. You can also drop KD, but I would advise against that and even more against dropping Expertise due to the Taunt / Expertise combo.

posts.author: campgod
posts.content: Great thanks Max! In your opinion is it worth it?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Max is right, although BG is one of the best choices to get 30 levels out him, this was a pure build and cannot be stronger than well-thought multi-class one. And yes you could incorporate Dev. Crit. into this one as well if you do as Max said, what feat you drop pre-epic is your choice.

What is forgotten perhaps, is that all three of us we have made other BG builds as well, My Antipaladin and MAx's Valen are two other choices you have but.. Would you like a real brute? I am not talking finesse here, i am talking something similar like we did in the pure builds with Theophilus and the Puissant Paladin now. I am talking about strength that can uproot trees and crash the necks of bullocks here. If yes, is the answer then try this one (also by Mick)

Champion Of Gruumsh -> http://nwnecbguild.forumer.com/topic/23 ... MlfGS5S38M

And this is how you modify it for getting also Dev. Crit. still with max strength.

a) Replace "toughness" with "great cleave"
b) Replace the two "improved sneak attack" feats with "overwhelming" and "devastating critical"
c) Change weapon to greatsword/ scimitar and shield

Have fun!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Great thanks Max! In your opinion is it worth it?
IDK, man. I think it's worth considering, but it would depend on how effective the toon would be without it where you play and how much more effective he would be with it. Honestly, here Mick goes for 40 STR, which is good for Devcrit DC. I would think it'd be nice to have, to say the least. A lot of servers have banned Devcrit and besides that a lot of players think it can be a little boring or "overpowered" so they don't take it, but if you are in neither situation, go for it! I would say it's a personal choice.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Paragon of Pain is designed to be a damage dealer with high AB. The AC and saves are not shabby either. I had mid-magic environments in mind when I made the build, even if I didn't say so explicitly. The build can be tweaked to some extent. Max has some suggestions. Tweaks will depend on where you play, and what is available there.
Devastating critical was not a priority with this build. If you want to take it, that will change the build, depending on what feats you toss out.

posts.author: campgod
posts.content: I just finished lvling this toon last night and it is a blast to play, what a beast! I did tweak it a bit and did what Max suggested and took Divine shield instead of IC. I can forge a weapon to have keen on it so that helped. I also dropped Epic fiend after I was done lvling cause it really has no use at lvl 40 for me. I took Epic toughness at re-lvl in its place. I changed some of the skill points around as well, for on my server it just seemed a better choice. With buffs I had listen at 55, which is alright but does not last that long so I drop that and UMD since on my server you are limited to what wands you can make and need a really high UMD. So after all that I had Perform 14(a server must for bard 8) Spellcraft 42,Discipline 43,Taunt 43,Tumble 40 and Concentration 43. I really like this toon! Good job!
